DataElement.preferredDefinition: The type of preservation procedure utilized to save a specimen by embedding it in support material to maintain the cells and tissues in a viable state.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Refers to preserved specimens embedded in support material.  These are typically cut into thin slices for microscopic examination, with or without an enhancement such as staining._Procedures utilized to save substances from decay. Some preservation procedures are meant to maintain cells, tissues, or organisms in a viable state.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Refers to preserved specimens embedded in support material.  These are typically cut into thin slices for microscopic examination, with or without an enhancement such as staining.

Concepts.definition: Refers to preserved specimens embedded in support material.  These are typically cut into thin slices for microscopic examination, with or without an enhancement such as staining.

Property.preferredDefinition: Procedures utilized to save substances from decay. Some preservation procedures are meant to maintain cells, tissues, or organisms in a viable state.

Concepts.definition: Procedures utilized to save substances from decay. Some preservation procedures are meant to maintain cells, tissues, or organisms in a viable state.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

DataElementConcept.origin: MCL:Molecular and Cellular Characterization of Screened Lesions
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 3/22/22 jk LabCas AI, released as part of quarterly draft content review. 10/29/19 jk upd LN to match C25436 synonym added for MCL.  10/15/19 jk created for LabCas PCA-Genomic pilot project.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Procedures utilized to save substances from decay. Some preservation procedures are meant to maintain cells, tissues, or organisms in a viable state._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A tissue sample that has been frozen prior to analysis.: To freeze rapidly so as to preserve structure and prevent ice crystal formation.

Concepts.definition: A tissue sample that has been frozen prior to analysis.
To freeze rapidly so as to preserve structure and prevent ice crystal formation.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Frozen Tissue Optimal Cutting Temperature Compound

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Frozen Tissue Optimal Cutting Temperature Compound
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition:
A tissue sample that has been frozen prior to analysis.
 
: A solution of water soluble glycols and resins that provide a specimen support matrix for cryostat sectioning at temperatures of -10 degrees C and below.

Concepts.definition: A tissue sample that has been frozen prior to analysis.
A solution of water soluble glycols and resins that provide a specimen support matrix for cryostat sectioning at temperatures of -10 degrees C and below.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Refers to samples that have been preserved with formalin and then embedded into a paraffin block for sectioning.

Concepts.definition: Refers to a process where a sample is preserved with formalin and then embedded into a paraffin block for sectioning.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.
